laboratory_examinations.findings: Normal levels of blood glucose, electrolytes, calcium, phosphorus, magnesium, protein, amylase, lipase, and lactic dehydrogenase were found, as well as normal results from renal- and liver-function tests.
Showed an infiltrative mass expanding from the splenium of the corpus callosum; lesions were isodense with respect to gray matter before contrast and enhanced intensely and uniformly after contrast.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: MRI scans obtained two weeks after the initiation of high-dose methotrexate showed a profound early radiographic response, with the splenial mass markedly decreased in size. Six months after initiation of treatment, MRI showed a complete radiographic response.

laboratory_examinations.date: Approximately four and a half years after initial presentation
laboratory_examinations.findings: Showed recurrent primary CNS lymphoma with a new mass in the splenium of the corpus callosum, mildly hyperintense on T2-weighted MRI and enhancing after contrast on T1-weighted MRI.
